project.teaser: Mobility is crossing a new digital frontier in terms of connectivity, allowing vehicles to communicate to each other, to the infrastructure and to other transport systems users. However, the potential implications and impacts of integration of CCAM solutions into the mobility...
project.objective: Mobility is crossing a new digital frontier in terms of connectivity, allowing vehicles to communicate to each other, to the infrastructure and to other transport systems users. However, the potential implications and impacts of integration of CCAM solutions into the mobility system are not well understood neither for specific actors nor for the systems level. MOVE2CCAM will: i) explore the impact of CCAM passenger and freight solutions; define use cases, business models and KPIs through co-creation activities with the “Satellites”, and ii) develop a practical system dynamics-based impact assessment tool that will enable the evaluation of CCAM interventions’ impact on mobility-, socio-economic-, public health- and environmental-related aspects considering diverse European region specifics and different actors’ needs, objectives and perceptions. The Satellites is a multi-systems network of actors across the whole CCAM ecosystem consisting of industries, authorities, researchers citizens, and orbits around the project by participating in a series of co-creation activities. Case studies for different types of organisations, dialogues, social simulation experiments, virtual reality games, and AV demonstrations take place in 8 European countries and at a pan-European level to collect data and specify the multi-systems impacts of CCAMs. The impact assessment tool will allow stakeholders to test and evaluate the system-wide impacts of CCAM interventions along with a range of complementary policies providing also a series of KPIs (within the project it is applied for Helmond(NL), GZM(PL), and Aegean Islands(GR). Given these activities, MOVE2CCAM significantly contributes to a well-founded understanding of the impacts of CCAMs. It will deliver impact evaluation frameworks and tools with KPIs covering sectors such as society, economy, and the environment; policy recommendations for CCAM partnerships and large-scale demonstrations; and recommendations for SUMP.
project.title: MethOds and tools for comprehensive impact Assessment of the CCAM solutions for passengers and goods
project.keywords: MOVE2CCAM, KPI, Satellites, SUMP, Vulnerable Groups, Dialogue, IAMT, Data Warehouse, Training

article.title: Building European capacity for Connected, Cooperative and Automated Mobility
article.teaser: New mobility solutions enabled by connected, cooperative and automated mobility (CCAM) will increase the safety, traffic efficiency and accessibility of Europe’s road transport system. This CORDIS Results Pack highlights 15 EU-funded projects addressing the technological, regulatory and social challenges of automated transport systems, paving the way for more sustainable and equitable transport in the future.

category.title: Results Pack
category.description: Article: Collections of results, from finished or nearly completed projects, focusing on a specific theme that you can apply in your domain

article.title: Ensuring AVs can safely navigate everything in their path
A model library of driving behaviours
All-weather sensors see driverless freight vehicles roll out at airports, ports and logistic hubs
Showcasing the benefits of automated vehicles for sustainable urban transport
Assessing societal impacts of new CCAM interventions
Developing robust self-driving vehicles that can go the distance
Decision-making tools for smarter, safer mobility
Trustworthy data is key to rolling out automated vehicles
Smart modelling leaves European gridlock in the rear-view mirror
Automated mobility starts with physical and digital infrastructure
Protecting Europe’s connected cars against cyberthreats
Putting citizens at the heart of the transport revolution
Establishing a European framework for connected, cooperative and automated driving
Assessing societal impacts of new CCAM interventions
article.teaser: Mobility planners need to take account of the social impacts of connected, cooperative and automated mobility technologies. The EU-funded Move2CCAM put citizens at the heart of this conversation.

article.title: Building European capacity for Connected, Cooperative and Automated Mobility

result.description: The results of the social and environmental analysis of the CCAM co-created scenarios - refined list of KPIs.

result.title: CCAM use cases, business model, scenarios and KPIs
result.description: The final CCAM use cases prototype business models scenarios and KPIs are presented The methods used will be described

result.description: Analysis and mapping of the needs and impact that the Satellites reported during the engagement activities. Comparison between organisations and citizens.

result.title: Initial data management plan
result.description: It will outline the types of data the project will produce and procedures for making them Findable Accessible Interoperable Reusable FAIR principles to any interested parties outside the consortium It will act as a guideline for designing the surveys processing analysing and sharing the data throughout the project

result.description: This deliverable reports the results of project dissemination and communication activities, both at scientific and general project level up to M18.

result.title: What Type of Self-Driving Vehicle Do Citizens Imagine? Results of a Co-Creation Dialogue Across Five European Countries

details.authors: Jonatan Viejo, Ana Quijano, Lucy Farrow, Selini Papanelopoulou

result.title: Final data management plan & the MOVE2CCAM data warehouse
result.description: It will describe the MOVE2CCAM data warehouse and the ways to find, access and reuse the data produced within the project after its completion.

result.title: Emerging methods to collect big data on travel experiences
Primary and secondary data, & the MOVE2CCAM data warehouse
result.description: Describes the tools designed to collect primary data, the secondary collected data and the architecture of the MOVE2CCAM data warehouse. It also includes the ethics forms that accompanied the data collection efforts.

result.title: The MOVE2CCAM impact assessment tool - Beta version
result.description: A report presenting the conceptual architecture of the CCAM systems dynamic model, the KPIs dashboard and the technical design of the MOVE2CCAM impact evaluation tool.

result.title: Recommendations & roadmap for CCAM partnerships
result.description: Roadmaps and recommendations for designing and evaluating CCAM partnership activities, CCAM large-scale demonstrations (ex-ante and ex-post), and public engagement activities. It also includes CCAM recommendations for SUMP.

result.title: The MOVE2CCAM impact assessment tool - Final version
result.description: A report presenting the CCAM systems dynamic model, the KPIs dashboard and the final MOVE2CCAM impact evaluation tool after it had been tested and verified by the Satellites. The report will also include components that will act as a user manual for the impact assessment tool.

result.title: Engagement activities summary - Mid-term
result.description: Summarizes all engagement activities, the engagement methods and provides KPIs about them.

category.title: satellite technology
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/mechanical engineering/vehicle engineering/aerospace engineering/satellite technology

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
